property.name: text
property.value: Set ID to be <your team ID>

property.name: text
property.value: Every second, trigger a read from the key-value store. The trigger input ensures that this occurs after the write that occurs at the same time.

property.name: text
property.value:
A robot that moves towards the last known position of an intruder, obtained by a range sensor.
Set initial position of robot.

property.name: script
description
property.value:
This accessor reads or writes data to a key-value store web service. The key and the value are both encoded using the JavaScript encodeURIComponent() function, and on retrieval, decoded using decodeURIComponent(). If remove is true and the key is non-empty, then upon firing, this actor will remove the specified key from the store, producing on its output the previous value (if any).

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To store a value with key MY_ID and value MY_VALUE, use 
       https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreClient.xml.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: error (port)
property.value: The error message if an error occurs. If this port is not connected and an error occurs, then an exception is thrown instead.

property.name: key (port-parameter)
property.value: Key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: remove (port-parameter)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: value (port-parameter)
property.value: Value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: Value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

property.name: key (port)
property.value: Key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: value (port)
property.value: Value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: script
description
property.value:
This accessor reads or writes data to a key-value store web service. A URL for the service is specified by the storeLocation parameter. A Ptolemy II model that provides such a key-value store service can be found at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreServer.xml. A demo client that uses this accessor is provided at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreClient.xml.

The key and the value are both text items provided as inputs. If remove is true and the key is non-empty, then upon firing, this actor will remove the specified key from the store, producing on its output the previous value (if any). If remove is false, then this actor will either set or retrieve a value in the key-value store, depending on whether the and the value input is non-empty. If the value is non-empty, then this actor sets the value. If it is empty, then this actor retrieves the value.

If an error occurs accessing the key-value store (e.g., no store is found at the specified URL, or no value is found with the specified key), then an exception is thrown.

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To store a value with key MY_ID and value MY_VALUE, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/set?id=MY_ID&value=MY_VALUE

  • To retrieve the value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/get?id=MY_ID

  • To remove a value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/delete?id=MY_ID

    The key and value are both encoded using the JavaScript encodeURIComponent() function, and on retrieval, decoded using decodeURIComponent(), and hence can include any text characters.

    Note that this accessor uses blocking reads to access the store, so if the store is remote, this could lead to sluggish responses.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.value: $$Id: KeyValueStore.js 1325 2017-02-06 22:42:51Z cxh $$

property.name: key (port-parameter)
property.value: Key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: remove (port-parameter)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: value (port-parameter)
property.value: Value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: The value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

property.name: key (port)
property.value: The key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: value (port)
property.value: The value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: storeLocation (port)
property.value: The URL of the key-value store service.

property.name: remove (port)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: text
property.value: Move towards the last known position of the intruder at maximum speed

property.name: expression
property.value: (in - currentPosition)*sqrt(speedLimit)/sqrt((in(0)-currentPosition(0))^2+(in(1)-currentPosition(1))^2)

property.name: script
description
property.value:
This accessor reads or writes data to a key-value store web service. A URL for the service is specified by the storeLocation parameter. A Ptolemy II model that provides such a key-value store service can be found at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreServer.xml. A demo client that uses this accessor is provided at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreClient.xml.

The key and the value are both text items provided as inputs. If remove is true and the key is non-empty, then upon firing, this actor will remove the specified key from the store, producing on its output the previous value (if any). If remove is false, then this actor will either set or retrieve a value in the key-value store, depending on whether the and the value input is non-empty. If the value is non-empty, then this actor sets the value. If it is empty, then this actor retrieves the value.

If an error occurs accessing the key-value store (e.g., no store is found at the specified URL, or no value is found with the specified key), then an exception is thrown.

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To store a value with key MY_ID and value MY_VALUE, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/set?id=MY_ID&value=MY_VALUE

  • To retrieve the value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/get?id=MY_ID

  • To remove a value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/delete?id=MY_ID

    The key and value are both encoded using the JavaScript encodeURIComponent() function, and on retrieval, decoded using decodeURIComponent(), and hence can include any text characters.

    Note that this accessor uses blocking reads to access the store, so if the store is remote, this could lead to sluggish responses.

property.value: $$Id: KeyValueStore.js 1325 2017-02-06 22:42:51Z cxh $$

property.name: remove (port-parameter)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: The value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

property.name: key (port)
property.value: The key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: value (port)
property.value: The value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: storeLocation (port)
property.value: The URL of the key-value store service.

property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

If remove is false, then this actor will either set or retrieve a value in the key-value store, depending on whether the and the value input is non-empty. If the value is non-empty, then this actor sets the value. If it is empty, then this actor retrieves the value.

If an error occurs accessing the key-value store (e.g., no store is found at the specified URL, or no value is found with the specified key), then an exception is thrown.
